intro: Eriostemon mollis, commonly known as the soft-leaved eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often found in shrublands and coastal heath communities. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
